title: Value, quality and use of OER – preliminary results of an empirical study in animal and food science

author: Anne Algers, Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences (SLU)

segmentation: I'm from Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences and I have been employed there for years, but now I'm swapping career I have.
I'm a PhD student at the University Bloomberg and I'm very pleased to be part of the Gogean network as well.
I'm going to present to you or share with you some preliminary results from a study I have just done.

And it's on animal welfare and food science, and I just want to tell you that this is one of four studies I'm going to do in my PhD and the results are really preliminary and I want to get criticism in order to be able to improve my analyzers.

But on the beliefs and the wishes of the consumers and the citizens is that we treat animals for food consumption in this way.

Have a reduced number of people living close to farm animals, which of course affect the knowledge about them and.

Of information which is contextualising animal welfare, and in this way facilitates understanding.

Hard to the welfare requirements of animals.

A huge you project, an integrated product will 50 two countries involved.

So it's about 48% which I think is good for a. Online survey, which is delivered globally.

It's about 5050 men and women.
They come from different cultures from the Nordic countries from US, from Anglo Saxon countries and other countries.
I have divided them in this way in order to do some statistics.

Other teachers are the researchers or do they have or the positions and others is.

Etc.

If they teach animal welfare.

In their ordinary teaching, so use E. Learning resources, yes or no.

Personal incentives for using.
We are the.
